text:
Hi, everyone.
Scarlett here "For the Win."

So, I'm actually kind of new
to the world of sports.

In fact, the only time
I'd get involved

is when I was hanging
with my friends.

I mean, I love watching
the Super Bowl commercials,

but I never really understood
the game of football itself.

It even took me a while
to figure out

that NFL stood
for National Football League.

Yep, I'm a total rookie.
Then something happened.

I started getting into the game
and learning some of the rules.

Football is actually
really cool.

My little brother plays and
sometimes I help his team out.

I still don't get all the rules,
but I can follow the game,

and now I'm a proud fan
of the Los Angeles Rams,

which has two
of my favorite players
and Super Bowl champs
Matthew Stafford
and Aaron Donald.

If you've ever seen
a football game on TV

and wanted to learn
a little more

of how to choose a team
and get involved,
you've come to the right place.
If you're from the west coast,

there's teams like
the Seattle Seahawks,

San Francisco 49ers,
Las Vegas Raiders,

Arizona Cardinals,
Los Angeles Rams,
and the Los Angeles Chargers,

which is where
Justin Herbert plays,
and he's amazing.

In the middle of the country,
there's teams

like the Denver Broncos,
Kansas City Chiefs,

Chicago Bears,
Cleveland Browns,

Indianapolis Colts,
the Cincinnati Bengals,
and the Tennessee Titans,

where running back
Derrick Henry plays--
also known as King Henry.
Such a cool name.

Up north, you've got
the Minnesota Vikings,

Green Bay Packers,
Detroit Lions,
and the mighty Buffalo Bills,

where quarterback
Josh Allen plays,

who can throw
and run like the best.

And if you live down south
there's the Dallas Cowboys,

where legendary wide receiver
CeeDee Lamb plays.

And then you've got
the Houston Texans,

New Orleans Saints,
Atlanta Falcons,

Tampa Bay Buccaneers,
Miami Dolphins,
and the Jacksonville Jaguars.

Yeah, the Jaguars
sound fierce, right?
Further up on the east coast,

there's a ton of teams
to choose from,

like the New England Patriots,
New York Jets,

New York Giants,
Pittsburgh Steelers,

Philadelphia Eagles,
Baltimore Ravens,

Washington Commanders,
and the Carolina Panthers.

You don't always have to root
for the team closest to you.

Maybe you don't live near
any teams but you love pirates?

You could root for the Raiders
or the Buccaneers.
Or perhaps you love giant cats.

There's the Jaguars,
the Panthers, or the Lions.

Maybe your cousin comes
from Texas

and they support
the Dallas Cowboys.
You could root for them, too,
and Micah Parsons,
one of the best linebackers
in the league plays for them.

There are so many
different ways
to pick a team.
It's kind of fun,

and you can pick
more than one team, too.
I'll let you in on a secret.

I actually also cheer
for the Cincinnati Bengals

because Joe Burrow plays
for them

and, well, I think he's one
of the coolest players
out there in the NFL.

And he just played
in the Super Bowl!
So wherever you come from

or whatever level your
knowledge is of the NFL,

it's really easy
to catch a game,

choose a team,
and start learning

a little more
about the game of football.

Trust me, before you know it,
you'll be the one explaining

to your friends
who some of the teams are
and what some of the rules mean.

So good luck to your team,
and if you don't have one yet,
go pick one and have some fun.

See you next time,
and don't forget,

you can watch
"Monday Night Football"
all season long on ESPN.
